page.title: 17NATURAL HISTORY, RAGDALE
page.content:
In this area of North_East Leicester_ shire there is much wild life to be found in the woods and fields around Ragdale.
An Ox Brook meanders through the area, passing near Thrussington Grange. The banks in this area are wooded and the whole stretch is kept by the landowner as a nature reserve. There are oak trees, hawthorn, ash and willows.
Squirrels, badgers, foxes and rabbits are to be seen.
There is evidence of many birds and a kestrel.
Wild flowers are to be found, including wild orchids and wild roses.
